timeline.message: set "kind" to "instance" , added "implementation" with a "description" and a blank url.  the url will have to be filled in with code based on env.
add kind:instance implementation:description and url through injection
add kind:instance implementation:description and url through injection

replies.bodyText: Not according to the conformance tool. It was failing due to not having the patient-export operation listed, and it passes like this.
replies.author: jonfulk

replies.bodyText:
is it because we place patient everything endpoint in the  patientExportEndpoint of the BDT tool?
cause https://hl7.org/fhir/uv/bulkdata/export/index.html#endpoint---all-patients is a thing that is different from patient everything
replies.author: MrBilnon

replies.bodyText: could be... i'll switch it back and remove the patientExportEndpoint from the config... it may just say that patient-export is not supported by our API, which I suppose is technically true?
replies.author: jonfulk

replies.bodyText: yep, we don't support patient-export as outlined in the bulk data export, don't know if we need to add a patient-everything to our capability statement
replies.author: MrBilnon

replies.bodyText: Ok, you're right that the issue was that I was listing the patient-everything endpoint as the patientExportEndpoint in the config, causing the test to require it in the operations. With an update to the config and a reversion to patient-everything, the conformance tests still pass. I'll update the PR momentarily.
replies.author: jonfulk

timeline.message:
fix: revert change to `patient-everything` operation
The conformance tests will still pass when the `patientExportEndpoint`
is not defined in the test config. The API does not support `patient-export`;
only `patient-everything`.
